Man its been a while since a doujin tried to have an interesting story aside from "you hot, lets fuck" and all these incel virgin losers only complain about him being a cuck or some bullshit like that.

You fucking ignorant have you ever read the story or what was happening? The guy was fucking withering away for nothing, he loved her but she didnt reciprocated her feelings as she kept on consuming the bits of soul the bastard had left.

The fact she even had sex with him in the first place was not out of love, she simply feed on him. The fact she seemed to be willing to stop having so much sex wit him (literally murder because no soul=no life) was because she didnt wanted to see him die.

That being said i feel like him dying instead of her jumping to save him would have been a much bitter sweet and mature ending rather than "loli saves you and living happily ever after" but whatever.

Great story, many of doujins that come out right now portrait succubuses like good girls that love the person they fuck, I like this approach more.
About the ending, I dunno which I like more, the idea of him dying and ending this story in a dramatic way or the possibility of a sequel and see more of this story... Probably the second but I don't want to see another happy ending. Art is top tier, I love Sabakus style, but this is just too short for me to fap to, the story would be also better if it was longer. I'll give it a 7.5/10
Looks like most of us can agree that him dying would be a better, bittersweet, way to have ended it.

Damn at least her intentions are on point. She doesn't want to consume his soul since she wants to spend more time with him but he's willing to go all the way. Makes you think if she had multiple partners like this and she had to see them all go because of her and if she's blaming herself. Let's see how far this goes :)
This was pretty interesting, bittersweet yes, open for more exploration but it also works well as a oneshot that lets you fill the gaps of the story by yourself.

This is one of those that I have to spend time to digest and think about, it reminded of this strange foreign movie that really stuck with me, it had a young girl that was some kind of monster living with an old man who had been taking care of her since he was young and well he died and throughout the movie the boy was ostracized and grew closer to her until he became her keeper.

Kinda bittersweet.
I love how we get a more detailed perspective of the character about his current circumstances.
7/10 with more potential if a sequel comes.
But probably not.
